intro: Sayeria subquadrata, commonly known as the quadrangular sayeria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its distinctive quadrangular stems and small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Sayeria subquadrata is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
